Articles.Content: Your idea of rest needs more boosters

Here\'s an idea for a part that I\'ve been thinking over:

A 0.5m, or maybe even 0.2m diameter solid rocket booster about the length of a standard fuel tank that can be mounted radially. It would have high thrust and very high acceleration, but it would have a rather short burn time of about five seconds.

It could be used for a multitude of purposes, such as satellite propulsion, lunar ascent, emergency de-orbiting, or as a means of accelerating a stage before ignition.

Here\'s an idea for a part that I\'ve been thinking over:

It could be used for a multitude of purposes, such as satellite propulsion, lunar ascent, emergency de-orbiting, or as a means of accelerating a stage before ignition.

Something like that is already over here -

http://kerbalspaceprogram.com/forum/index.php?topic=2770.0

but the more options the merrier, of course.

DON\'T GIVE ME IDEAS
Higher thrust with smaller engine bells/combustion chambers doesn\'t make sense. There\'s a reason powerful engines like the F-1 and RD-170 are HUGE.
When will 1.0 come out?

When will 1.0 come out?

Nova want\'s a break, after all the work he\'s done i\'d say some time.
Don\'t stop me noooww~
Watch out for falling foam strikes
Or the Rods of God... I have a feeling that Nova is siphoning the military\'s budget.

And so I decided to use this pack since Nova had already permitted mixing this with other mods and I made a simple orbiter rocket.

And damn:

'Error (509)

This account\'s public links are generating too much traffic and have been temporarily disabled!'

Heh? This - this can\'t be happening...NOOO!!!

After my computer\'s hard drive crashed and I lost everything :\'( I needed to download all the mods again, and now when I do...this?!

Wow... my luck lately...

This account\'s public links are generating too much traffic and have been temporarily disabled!'

Oh, sorry. See I know nothing about everything so I didn\'t know what a mirror was lol but thanks for not insulting my stupidity like some other people on the forums do to people who ask stupid questions.

Not sure if he even added it.

Not sure if he even added it.

He hasn\'t, yet.

He hasn\'t, yet.

RELEASE IT DAMNIT.

Nah, but it\'d be a cool thing to have for mock-docking missions.

I am dissapoint.

Space orbital docking is my best skill. Well, other than crashing.

Btw, I worked this up to help me decide which booster(s) to use. Thought it might be helpful for others.

[table]

[tr][td]booster[/td] [td]burn time (seconds)[/td] [td]thrust (newtons)[/td] [td]impulse (newton-seconds)[/td] [td]mass (kg)[/td] [td]delta-v (m/s)[/td][/tr]

[tr][td]rt-10[/td] [td]30[/td] [td]140[/td] [td]4200[/td] [td]2[/td] [td]2100[/td][/tr]

[tr][td]rt-20[/td] [td]60[/td] [td]180[/td] [td]10800 [/td] [td]4[/td] [td]2700[/td][/tr]

[tr][td]rt-b20[/td] [td]80[/td] [td]70[/td] [td]5600[/td] [td]2[/td] [td]2800[/td][/tr]

[tr][td]rt-x20[/td] [td]75[/td] [td]140[/td] [td]10500[/td] [td]6[/td] [td]1750[/td][/tr]

[/table]

DV capacities, though any real rocket will have lower values as these are calculated assuming that nothing but the booster itself is being used.


RT-10:	6210 m/s
RT-20:	7985 m/s
RTX-20: 5803 m/s
RT-B20:	10.5 km/s
I saw some pics of rover wheel tests a while back. Were those ever added?

I saw some pics of rover wheel tests a while back. Were those ever added?

They were intended for the Probodyne pack, Nova decided not to release them because they liked to bend and explode.
Thanks to this pack, I\'ve now learned how to use RCS thrusters like a boss. 8)

1. I have 17 RCS fule tanks, 16 are the outside balls and the 17th is a single wide one. For some reson the game chooses the 16 balls first and uses them up in about 3 seconds.

But thats not the problem, when one gets used up then its fuel seems to re-set so I always have 16 full and 1 being used no matter what.

2. Your cover dosent break off at all. Not in the atmosphere or in space, it just stays attached and dosent do shit! *ragequit*

3. not your problem: but this pack lags SOO MUCH for me D:
